reviews.Comment: for my beginning at McGill university in accounting, this teacher made it disaster. he is very difficult to understand, dont answer questions. dont take his class

I once decided to chart how often he used the phrases "these are things you need to be aware of" "was that clear" "is this ok" "obviously" which he uses to string sentences that make up the entire lecture, while reading slides for 3 hrs, a page later, gave up and stopped attending class and studied at home. he's THE worst. how is he a McGill proff?

At first impression, you will think he is a good prof, but then he will start reading the slides the whole class long which is gonna give you panic. I wished he could change the way he teach. he never made any effort to explain. just tells you " you need to think about it and you should be comfortable about it". the midterm exam was awful
He is a good teacher but he style of teaching makes the course very heavy. I would like to have a choice but He was the only teatcher for Contining Education students. I don t know why.

He is a nice person, but many of his explanations are unclear because he keeps saying the same words after each sentence he reads such as"these are the things you have to think about and all those types of things".Half of your class you will hear his read the answers to the homework and the other half he will read the slides. Does not answer emails

Very unclear lectures and goes on and on to explain stuffs that don't matter. Gives you long quizzes but waste a great portion of class time explaining materials not covered in the quiz. Sometimes he tests you on materials he hasn't yet covered in class. He also has a lot of mistakes in his answer keys. Don't take the class with this prof!

Extremely unclear in his lecture, so be prepared to self study a great portion of the course. This prof has never answered any of my emails, so help is not necessarily always there. He made multiple mistakes grading my work and after explaining to him the mistakes, my mark went up by two letter grades. Overall, I do not recommend this prof...

As a person he is a very nice teacher, always willing to help if you go see him during office hours. However, in class he is not very clear, made the material more confusing than it actually was, so had to read the textbook. Overall, confusing teacher, but exams were fair and if you put in the time this class is an easy A.
Just a bad teacher overall, isn't even qualified.
Good prof. Moves at a followable pace.

Does not know how to teach. Seems like he doesn't know the information himself when he is teaching. Handwriting is god awful and illegible. Unfair with grading and does not provide clear guidelines to what he expects. Quizzes are much harder and do not reflect what is taught in class.

His lectures follow no logical structure and seem to jump from topic to topic. What we learn in class is so much easier than what he makes us do on assessments, and on those assessments he shows no mercy with the grading. No curve and the average is about a 60 right now.

Prof. van der Ven is an amazing lecturer! Going to class was a pleasure. He made his already clear and organized lectures enjoyable by adding educational clips or in-class examples using volunteering students. On top of being funny and passionate, he was seeking students' feedback mid-semester to better his teaching for current and future students.

Prof VdV is really good, very dynamic during lectures and accessible outside of class. His exams were very easy, but his group project was really badly organised (15 people in a group, during springbreak, a nightmare). The conference were a joke and a waste of time but that was mostly the TA's fault. The subject was fantastic and I loved it. ��

His first semester at mcgill, and you can kind of tell. However, his lectures are informative and entertaining and overall I just loved this class. The group project was annoying only because the first presentation was 2 days after classes resumed.

Super sweet prof and amazing at teaching! I took her principles of marketing and it was my favorite class of U0. The class is very group work heavyand you should pick a good group. The exam has a lot of memorization and understanding, but as long as you follow what you learned in class you can succeed. She is VERY organized and her slides are great
Her lectures are very clear

1) Group projects are worth 50% of your grade (3 presentations and a report). You need to pick good groupmates. Final is worth 50%. 2) Good marks for the projects up until course evaluations then drops after lol. 3) Attendance is checked blanks on slides to be filled out in class. 4) YUGE curve on the final grade, I went from 76 (w fnl) to an A LOL

Claire is such a sweetie. She's always willing to help you out when you need her! Your whole grade is group projects (3 presentations) besides the final exam, but you pick your group so make sure you chose people you can count on because getting an A on the projects is difficult, you really have to try hard and put.

Very good professor, very nice and very knowledgeable. If you don't understand something, go ask her after class. Half of your grade will come from group projects so pick wisely. Hard to get higher than B+ because she curves every grade (85 is the max) No midterm final was ok but a lot of material had to be covered so don't wait. Attendance graded

She is a nice lecturer. Half of your grade is from group projects so pick your team well. She tries to stay between the 65-75% average so it's hard to get a high grade. The final is really about understanding marketing more than memorizing the material she gives.

Prof Neslehova cares about her students. However, she seems unaware of the fact that students have other courses. This is one of the heaviest assignment courses I have taken after 3 years of math! She's accessible, and answers questions clearly, but I didn't find her lectures as clean as other people did. Would avoid unless you adore statistics.

Johanna is the best stats prof that I've had at McGill. Her lectures are extremely clear and she is very kind and helpful during office hours. GLM is a great class, and the material is truly interesting. I'm an engineering student but I was able to get A just by attending lectures and reading the Agresti book thoroughly.

Overall, it was a very challenging class. Johanna gives practice exams before the midterm and final, which are REALLY helpful in my opinion because the material is very hard and there's a lot of it! The book was useful but not necessary! Only take this class if you're willing to put in the hard word
Johanna is a great prof. She goes fast, but she will post useful material and usually is very helpful in office hours.

She is good compared to other statistics professors, but she teaches very fast. However, her notes are clear and she is helpful during office hours. I took math 523 with her and she started rushing through the course material after the midterm - it was crazy. Finally, her assignments are helpful for learning the material, but they are very long.

GLM itself is a hard course. Professor Neslehova's not the best one, but certainly not the worst. You need to read the textbook before lectures or you will be lost forever because she goes over material real fast. The exam and assignments are tough but the grading is not that harsh.
would not recommend

She seems to know her stuff but not an amazing teacher. The 8:30 lectures really put you off, I learned everything from this class from the book and by doing the assignments. The class's more about memorizing the assignments than understanding mechanics. It's also useless for EE majors, it should be removed. Good thing I took it online.

CIVE 281 is a required course in the Electrical Engr curriculum but is so useless that you will not need it for anything in your entire degree at McGill or after. It makes no sense to make this a prereq for ECSE362. This course is very difficult, proff doesnt help and is purely unnecessary. Help out new students by taking this course of curriculum.

Strongly recommend staying away from this class at all cost. Prof is unclear in her usage of variables, unclear flow of explaining problems. Concepts are made much harder than they really are by confusing you and spending a lot of time on useless algebra. Unenthusiastic about answering questions and will make shame for asking. Save yourselves.
The course is terribly designed with difficult final exams
Had her for 3 years at Dawson, she may be tough and hard to understand but she genuinely cares for her students and will make sure you understand everything. very approachable during office hours

Same teaching style as Chu (problem-based method that is a pretty huge help with assignments and exams), but far more unpleasant - very in-your-face and condescending in class, and treats all her students like disobedient children. At least her teaching actually helps you learn the material...

The material she taught was extremely difficult, but by solving the examples in class she made it very clear and easy to understand. Her exam questions require you to understand the material. Nice prof.
She doesn't put anything online at all, I had to teach myself all the material. Utterly incomprehensible.
Good Prof in general, she cares about the material, but is very intense and sometimes hard to understand.

She has a wierd accent, but once you start understanding her she's great. Like altough the material she was teaching wasn't easy, i found it extremely easy to follow her lectures bc when solving examples she's explaining every single step

Her voice is so loud and annoying, plus she has a wierd accent... But the real problem is that she almost doesn't put anything on WebCT. On the other hand she's very nice and she explains the material well
Uncomprehensible
Her face angers me. Watching her speak with unspeakable facial expressions and with total confidence in her incorrect sentences and pronounciations is simply frustrating.

Shes the 101 dalmatian lady. Shes soooo nice though. She will help u anytime and shes okay in marking. Chu is also okay, he says alot mulCHUply instead of multiply. Hes funny in that sense. Well anyways, eascy course, cheat sheet is allowed and put assignment problems on it and u should pass. Good Luck!
she goes very fast, but as long as you follow what she is saying, you will understand very well, she is also quite helpful although she looks mean

Very High Pitch Voice prevents me from understanding what she is saying. How irritating Both Babarutsi & Chu know that if they put their slides online no student would bother staying in class with their poor teaching skills.

One of the best prof's i've had at McGill. Truly cares about your understanding of the material. Incredibly patient and helpful when approached individually. Very knowledgable; demonstrates her thorough understanding of the material through getting to the root of your question. a tough marker though

doesnt she look like the evil lady in 101 dalmatians? her accent is quite strong but it can be funny at times "I got Twooo balls, I hiiit them together" She goes quite a bit faster than Chu but thats not bad thing
you WANT SLIDES? on WEBCT? NO!!! it is very STRAITFOVAD...
I'd like to believe she has good intentions, but her evil sounding voice is not what you like to hear at 8:30 in the morning...
Prrrety Strrrraightfoward !!!! Very very annoying teacher, but not the worst I've seen at McGill. Gordon Edwards tops them all.
character right of off aunt from My Big Fat Greek Wedding...
No Comments
Better write quickly... the notes go off fast.
All problems are STRRRRRRAIGHTFOWARD and are simple algebra.
Goes too fast, but very passionate in teaching.
No Comments
bangs mechanics into your head like beating rhythm into a bongo - but it works!
Looks like edith prikly (SCTV). Too funny to learn anything
insanely loud! and keeps banging on the desk! headaches will ensue!!!
Russian teaching methods... can be good or bad
No Comments
No Comments
Very clear and very LOUD!! you are guaranteed not to fall asleep...:)
He is just the nicest professor. The course is very hard but he is doing everything step by step with us. Without him I wouldn't have a good foundation in econometrics
He is simply the nicest professor I have ever met. He is approachable, willing to accommodate students with weaker background, and go over materials that are covered in previous courses.

Decent class, I think there is quite a steep learning curve with stats in general which makes the class kinda hard. HW assignments were pretty fair and the TA graded them pretty leniently. The final was hard but curved. He's a really caring guy who always helps during OH cause the material can be pretty whack sometimes.
He knows how to teach Ph.D. students.

This Prof is not a good Prof. He does not know how to teach however he tries very hard which is respectable. He curves a lot so you have a chance but if you don't spend all your time analyzing every line from his mistake-filled lectures you are doomed!

Pros: He's a great dude. Clearly cares a ton about the subject matter and about the students. Tests are pretty similar to the homework. Cons: He's an absolutely terrible teacher; I had no idea what he was talking about for 3/4 of the class. Textbook is almost worthless. Ended up reading statistical papers online and memorizing proofs to do well.

Econ department needs new blood. He might not be the best prof at explaining the material, but his dedication makes me admire him. I remember seeing him rushing for a sandwich and then going to teach another graduate course. He is an honorable professor. Sincerely.
Self-learning regression. Boost my math maturity entirely by myself.
This class definitely takes a lot of effort on your part but if you follow his lectures and read the textbook, you should be fine
not good

Listen up kids! Ignore ALL comments that come from 2019. It was his first year teaching undergrads after teaching at a higher level. He has improved a lot! He explains concepts clearly and slowly, encourages questions, and has straightforward assignments. He is also helpful in OH. His midterm was too long, but FAIR (reflective of the assignments).
I think I fail the midterm. please curve the grade.
he is a nice dude. But overall, he is over the top disorganized, mumble through class, so everyone is discouraged. I wont take his class again

Apparently this man knows a lot but his problem is that he doesn't know how to teach at all. The material is like an intro to econometrics which is very challenging to undergraduates. I barely understand what he taught in class and managed to get a A at last by reading the textbook and teach myself. The final was not that bad.

Incredibly disorganized class. It was his first time teaching an undergraduate course, so it's normal that it's not smooth sailing. However, the course was very difficult to follow since nothing was clear. He is very sweet and wants to help but doesn't seem to know how to explain since he assumes we know much more than we should.

Waaay over-complicates material to the point that it demotivates you from going to class. Doesn't post any notes or materials online, and provides no practice before exams. Had a really bad time in his class but it was his first time teaching an undergrad course; hopefully he matures as he continues to teach.
4 words: ALL OVER THE PLACE. look up the definition of disorganization and her name will appear

Is very perplexing. She is ok when teaching but gets upset at students very easily. Assignment descriptions and rubrics are unclear and confusing. She gets frustrated when we don't understand her instructions. If you have to take her class, don't freak out, it's still manageable, but do avoid her if you can.

The grading criteria is unclear. Poor communication. Extremely disorganized. Her course outline was riddled with errors and inconsistencies and she didn't follow it at all. She seems really nice, but the struggle is real.

Mediocre prof. I took her class during the pandemic so it was online.. which probably did not help. Her lessons were unnecessarily long and redundant. Students were often confused by what they were supposed to do or what was happening in general. At least she was nice..!
I have no idea what these comments are reffering to. This was a great class overall. Not difficult, very informative, and well taught.

Horrible teacher! Avoiddddd! She is incredibly rude in lectures and does not discuss multiculturalism, as she only focuses on black and white relations. She is unclear in lectures and unhelpful when you ask for help. However, she is a very easy marker and the class is an easy A.

One of the worst profs I ever had. Biased against white students. It is not a multicultural lesson because she speaks only about black and white relations, and white privilege. Easy marks though. I do recommend another prof. Random readings given last minute. Doesn't know how to use the technology and wastes time trying.

Content was very clearly explained in lectures AND on the slides (very detailed and include a lot of images to explain abstract concepts). lectures are very engaging, professor Warburton is an amazing lecturer, very eloquent, caring and just, He answers all questions and lectures often included live demos and board calculations!

Professor Warburton was very helpful and engaging in this intro-level physics class. If you participate in class and show interest, you will definitely achieve a good grade. He does many practical demonstrations and experiments for concepts that are harder to grasp.

As someone who isn't a physics major, I thoroughly enjoyed this class because it allowed me to ask questions about physics that have always intrigued me. It was a great opportunity to explore and satisfy my curiosity about the some physical concepts. The practice exam questions are great tool to prepare for exams.

Material was consistently connected to current and relevant experiences that were directly related to students or the instructor. This made the content uniquely engaging and original. Andreas Warburton encouraged discussion from students and took the time to learn the names of students that participated.
Definitely would recommend taking the course if you are looking for something interesting and not too difficult. Overall, a great professor and an interesting course.

The course has changed a lot from past years and is focused on the students. The material is not too tough and there is always support available online or in person. The grading is quite forgiving with feedback given at a reasonable time. Sample papers and guides also given for the midterms and final which show the level perfectly. Recommended!

Andreas does his best to make sure the concepts were explained clearly and there was always active discussion in class, online or in his office hours regarding material or anything in general. The content itself was also fun! The grading is also made so that students can make the most of it and with just a little work a high grade is achievable.

Dr. Warburton is incredibly kind and respectful. He listens to students and is exceptionally humble despite being very success in his field. This said, PHYS 181 is no longer a super easy course - there are a lot of concepts and the midterm and final is harder than you would assume it would be.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF. He literally takes off your mark from assignments for no reason and unclear instructions for all grading schemes and there is no room for you to negotiate because the assignments are graded SO SLOW and once it is the end of the semester, you do not have the time and energy to debate for marks. AVOID HIS PHYS 181!!
TRY TO AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS. Extremely dysfunctional course structure+lecture + never gives feedback/practice materials.
Never imagined a 100 level phys course would have a midterm average of c+. Tons of info and hard to follow. Don't take unless S/U.

One of the best of profs of the physics department. Hilarious, and can be very dorky in a great way. Is a lot more relaxed in 258. Is really good at public speaking! I see why they send him to the international meetings in the states.
His lectures for 257258 are so boring. It is very difficult to stay focused. He is funny and a nice guy, but staying awake during his lectures is hard.
Very understandable lecturer and a generally great guy.
Phenomenal astrophysics professor! I might even say stellar

I have never met a University prof that was so caring and involved with his students, while being so knowledgable in higher level, beyond the scope of the class kind of things. As long as you actually work hard and use the resources Prof. Warburton gives you, you will do very well. He's a genuinely kind guy, and brilliant to boot.

Prof Warburton is an awesome teacher. He is clear, very fair, and willing to help you out if you have a problem on something. He is a good speaker, he is interesting and funny. While he does give big C programming assignments that are very long and a final quiz that was rather tricky, it was still do-able and OK. Thank you professor for the course.
One of the coolest professor ever. Understandable, nice,very clear, he is the ideal professor.
Very helpfull. Very clear. The teaching was a bit too slow for me but that was probably the course (experimental methods). Overall superb.
Great prof, but gives way too much information on the subject and his final was just plainly impossible to do.
Richard is an amazing teacher! His class is fair and realistic of what social workers would encounter in their practice. I would definitely take another of his classes, too bad he only teaches one!

Rick is extremely fair. He does not believe in memorization; the final exam is open book and the assignments are done in groups. He is extremely knowledgable in the field and is very useful for answering questions. Most of the class is spent going over the course pack so attendance isn't mandatory but his comments are important.
Very useful class, the coursepack is a bible for all budding social workers. He is hilarious and is basically Larry David undercover!
Best prof I've ever had! He has a great sense of humour he's extremely helpful. Ask him any question and he'll be pleased to answer! Montreal's Woody Allen!
extraordinary prof! the trick is to participate in class. if you participate, you're guaranteed an A. he's not out to trick you - very straight-forward! his great sense of humour is a plus!

AMAZING class, AMAZING prof! He is like a walking encyclopedia! Ask any question and he knows plus he is a law graduate! It was an honor to be taught by him! Exams are easy, but make sure you put ALOT of detail!
Make sure you ask questions! What he says he wants, and how he ends up grading are 2 different things. You'll do great if you really participate.
No Comments
Wonderful to listen to.
a superb teacher
Iwona Perlin was my TA in Ancient European History. she was very helpful and very understanding. Very approachable. Her explainations were clear. My best TA to date! She'll make a great professor!
No Comments
No Comments

Stephane is definitely very demanding, and does not expect students to take the easy route. Be prepared for a lot of homework, and very long lectures. Also, the homework usually consists of long readings and difficult essays.
Stephane was a great teacher. Always knew how to make the class laugh while keeping the overall atmosphere professional, not easy to do for such a young prof. Congrats!
No Comments
The only pedagogue McGill has in Physed dept. very compassionate. love his students, amazing teacher. very caring. don't miss his class

GREAT PROF! He is so nice and he genuinely wants you to succeed so he will always help you if you seek help (before the assignment due date). He is also very understanding of personal situations. I have had him 3 times in the past 4 years - loved him each time even if I didn't get a good grade!
best teacher ever! he makes your class so enjoyable :)
Best teacher ever. You will learn so much from him and his class is a blast!
Holy**** GO is the man!!!!! Take his class, he's the best you'll ever have!
By far the best teacher I've ever had. Very hlepful and caring. Was even given an award as Quebec's best teacher. Take him if you have the privilege to do so.
Take this class. You will learn the most important things about being a teacher from this teacher!

This is one of the core courses that teaches you how to be a phys.ed. teacher. Elementary school games, party games, sports, invent your own game, play games your classmates invent. Gordon is an AWESOME teacher. His jokes will have you laughing so hard you'll crawl across the gym floor.
2 credit class. Lots of fun. Learn games for elementary school kids. Physically active. Amazing eduacator! You can learn a great deal about teaching that is not limited to physical eduaction.
Great teacher...great class. I reccommend it to everyone...you will have so much fun, while learning a great deal of stuff
a real scientist and the best prof I meet at McGill
it is a bit hard for people who can not calculate.
very useful
Great professor
Course plan difficult to graps and complicated to understand
very good one
good teacher!!!

No Comments
He is very friendly. some of his lectures are not easy to follow, but if you pay attention it's fine. You will learn a great deal from him. A truely amazing professor.

I don't know if he is retired, I took his class some time ago... This guy is excellent! He is the incarnation of elegance. He is very clear and if you show interest, he gives amazing examples of how the theory applies to varies situations. Truly the best professor at McGill. I had an amazing learning experience with him.
Entertaining, interesting subject. Be a good student and you've got a 1-credit A

Straight forward class on morals and ethics... You be the judge of it. Class is straight forward. Final was easy but written weirdly in that some questions seemed to have multiple answers. Just do your work and get the nice little GPA boost.
The course is not so interesting, but gives an overview of all the different engineering departments at McGill.
Boring as hell class, but it's her baby and she takes it really seriously. Gives out marks for attendance, but you only need to pay attention to the lecture on ethics and OIQ to do well.
Great prof, nice voice. Easy teacher. How often does that happen in Engineering.
Great prof. Very passionate, helpful and approachable.
Very nice and helpful teacher. And as the other students have mentioned, she's hot.
She's so hot that she makes me want to go into civil engineering just so she can work on my retractable bridge (Thrust bridge).

Number of Ratings: 11. Hotness total: 11. This is what happens when female professors teach engineering, huh? Apart from looks, she's a pretty good teacher and obviously cares about the subject material. Don't skip class too much though, there's some info on the midterm/final that she only says in class and not on the online slides
Great teacher, very organized ,clear and approachable, and as already said, easy on the eyes.
shes a pretty good prof, but make sure you attend this class, even tho the slides are online, theyre not the clearest. shes a looker
SHES SO HOT I LITERALLY FANTASIZED ABOUT HER EVERY LECTURE. Dont need to go to class at all, just look at lecture slides online. Exam was fair.
great teacher, very involved and clear in her lectures. cares about students.
Good looking, interesting, very clear, fair grading, Hope she was teaching more classes
clear, not hard, interesting, good looking
great prof, very interested in material, extremely kind, always available for help with assignments...pretty easy course as well
No Comments
Great prof! Always available for questions. Well organized presentations.
Very good teacher. Knows the material perfectly and has a talent to explain everything in an interesting and clear manner. Be sure to practice problems that he suggests and you will succeed.
Loved this teacher! explained the material properly and was very helpful.
very good teacher, very helpful to all his students. Takes the times to explain the material.
This is the best teacher that I have ever had! He is very clear with his examples and knows his material. If you have the chance do take him .
very good teacher makes the class interesting
Super teacher!
Did not like him. Can be intimidating when he makes you go in front of the class to demonstrate your solution on the board. And this does not ount for any marks as participation.
A very nice man- but he has no gift to teach
Fantastic prof, fantastic guy. Definitely worth his office hours for the extra essay help. He provides ALL possible midterm questions WAY in advance, so no surprises.

I love him. He's adorable and extremely helpful and witty. Although lectures can be potentially dull, they move quickly and his enthusiasm is contagious. He has a passion for the English language that inspires students to dedicate time and effort to learning. Really fantastic.
Basically copies Jessica Riddell's style. Unreasonable marker. His lectures can get a bit dry, but he tries. Good selection of material, though.

Extremely helpful & friendly and very clear lecturer. I enjoyed this class and found it really useful. See him during office hours to get advice on your essays. An A is not impossible but you definitely need to be a very strong writer. Proofread your work thoroughly.

Great prof! don't waste a chance to take a class with him! he's funny and a great lecturer. As for getting an A in this class.. well let's say an A- is possible if you work really hard! he's really helpful - not an easy grader but it's mcgill ur talking about- u cannot get As if you dnt work hard to earn them

He is the coolest guy ever and has a great sense of humor. He loves it when students ask him for help, and is extremely helpful. He knows his information very well, and always tries to engage the class. However, he is not the easiest grader. You have to work hard for the class, but it will pay off. Definitely going to take another class he teaches
This professor gives grade really hard. He's a harsh marker and he doesn't tell you what to change for the next assignment. The class is the worst class I attended in my life.
Brilliant, funny, keeps it real. Much more self-aware than other professors in the department. Knows pop culture better than most of his students. Best prof I've had at McGill.
Funny and knows films!

I would disagree with the previous comments. His lectures were very dull, and his explanations of the concepts were fair at best. I learned more by reading wikipedia the week before the exam so I could finally understand what he was attempting to explain, albeit in a more complicated manner.

This class seemed like it could be so boring but it ended up being one of my favourites, and the only one where I actually did all the reading. This prof is really good at explaining really difficult concepts.
I love this class. Great teacher, interesting readings, good lectures.
cool guy

Boz is a really cool guy. He is so passionate about Geology he almost makes it interesting. He's also super understanding and helpful. The class structure is neat for a 200 level - 20 person class and for the second half of the semester the students teach every Thursday! Fun class but slightly repetitive if you have already taken ENVR200, GEOG203
Loved him! He is expecting a lot from his students but he is great and is really helpful. He knows a lot and his lectures are always interesting. I loved how he can be really sarcastic.
Very handsome, Teaches extremely well for the material that he has to work with. big distraction in class because I can't help but to stare at him.
He's really a sweet guy, tall dark and handsome. He teaches well too, although I was easily distracted by his overall appearence. ;)
Prof. Nalca is great.He is a very nice person, he is very very helpful and he cares whether you learn.He has a positive attitude, he is not easy, but he somehow makes you learn the hard stuff.
No Comments

Arcan rocks! This semester was his first time teaching and he managed to be clear and to explain well. He's very cool and answers every question as best as he can. Always trying to make everyone understand. I said it before, and I'll say it again... Arcan rocks!

Possibly the most interesting course of my whole mba, I agree with other posters, felt more a seminar than a course. No academic learning. I felt I learned a lot and have recommended this course to others, unfortunately the teacher of this course has changed so I am not sure.

Not the easiest not the hardest course, perhaps the only one which gave me the feeling of getting a real life view. The teachers delivers what promises, so check the first class if you want to stay in the course or switch to a lighter one. Workload is quite a bit, exams are not easy but fair, no surprises. I do recommend this course.

Although my grade did not turn out what I expected to be, the course was greatly helpful. Feels about as a seminar where a speaker comes to class as a break from his daily job. Very useful insights on the real world. Just a warning, the course is not as easy as it seems, I was mislead thinking to give a quick reading of the slides. Not enough.

Just finished the classes yesterday, I can confirm what others said here, the course is recommendable because of its practical nature, something you do not encounter easily at McGill (probably in all major universities...). He is indeed a very respectable person and instructor from all standpoints. I thought he gave us a lot.

Thumb up, saved my last term from "zero utility" rating. He is no BS, delivered what he said, practical knowledge, not academic lectures in conflict with the tough business reality (having 20 years work experience I can tell...). Overall this and other 3 courses are leaving me something worthy in my whole McGill MBA.... Aaargh!

Very nice course. As he stated in the first class when you look backwards at the end of the course you realize a lot of material can be applied immediately in several work situation (not just project management: his communication mgmt class was killer!). I also liked the fact he devoted half class to ethics, a novelty in most MBA programs.

Just completed the course yesterday, really happy of having taken it, no regrets at all. I can confirm what others wrote, the course is rather straightforward and at the end you are left with practical ready-to-use knowledge, which in my MBA experience turned out to be the exception rather than the norm. Thumb up, he is a nice guy too.

Top notch course, practical, dry and operational: at the end I have material ready to use. Rarely I found a course this practical and focused, so kudos to him, who happens also to be really fair and reasonable. Workload is considerable but not hard at all.

Really nice course, one of the very few I can think of giving me some ready to use knowledge (which he said was his main goal). Liked his non-academic style. He brought a lot of real world insight which academic teachers almost always lack. I will recommned this course to anyone although the workload is not little. At the end I feel it was worth.

I agree with what said by others, this is a meat only course, no bones and that is what I liked the most. Maybe dry but far many MBA courses are too wet. Really nice person and well targeted course. I really appreciated the material added to the textbook. I'd recommend this course and professor to anyone.

Last and best course of my MBA. He is more a professional than a professor, in the good way, I mean his teaching is more practical than academic. You need courses like this. He provides very useful additional material on top of the textbook, which he does not seem to like much. Exemplary fairness and great perspectives on real life work.

Class was kind of boring but was not his fault, proj. management is just not the most exciting subject. He still works as a project manager full-time so he has interesting insight into the field. Great slides that follow the textbook. Straightforward exams. Overall, a nice fair guy with a somewhat dry course, but u can actually learn so
No Comments
He's smart amd funny, but when it comes to teaching, it's another story!
No Comments
Awesome teacher! Does his best to make you interested in the subject, although sometimes unclear about his thoughts.
brilliant guy, ideal prof. he's SO dedicated.
No Comments
Great professor, inspiring, gives great lectures very charismatic prof, well-spoken Fair grader
Vert interesting class; but tough,very good professor
great class, great prof

Intro to 18th C. Art and Architecure - totally not my thing, but it was still a good class. He's a hard marker, but he gets really into his lectures and tries to involve the class. Worked really hard for this class, but I enjoyed it.

Kind of a dreamboat (good looks and british accent). Thoughtful marker; like most profs, if you see him during his (ever popular) office hours, you'll be better off. Extremely knowledgeable and really wants to teach, and knows that he doesn't know everything. Recommended - he made theory fun!

he talks like he's reading out of a dictionary, and quickly. i had to teach most of the theories to myself because all i did in class was sweat trying to keep up with what he was saying. he's lucky he's good-looking...that said, he's not a bad marker for papers (did mine the night before/day of and he somehow found them to be of quality)

Sometimes I wondered if his class was about art or about 18th century British and French history. Fairly easy marker. Very helpful outside of class. Also, incredibly hot...you'll want to attend every class even if you don't have to after the midterm.
Really great professor and is super helpful :)
Great prof marking is fairly easy makes things intresting.

18th century European Art. Professor Taws is an overall excellent professor. Always available to meet with students, help with questions, suggests excellent secondary reading. Super organisation, wants and appreciates class participation. Show him you've put some thought into what you wrote and you'll be rewarded. Any course of his is recomended.
This lab was great and I had a blast! Take Prof. Musallam, he is a good guy and will help you graduate~

I really enjoyed Control Lab. Unlike other labs which often take so much time that you cannot focus on your other classes, this lab had an appropriate workload and Prof. Musallam taught all of the material necessary to complete the lab. Very straightforward and very glad I took this course!

The least organized prof I've had. There have been numerous classes that didn't start until 20 mins in due to problems that could be avoided with some foresight the night before. Has cancelled the more classes than anyone else. He can only explain things in one way.
He cares for his students. Midterms & Final exam are similar to howework assignments. Do your assignments - it helps!
Karen makes learning Hebrew easy and really fun. She's really cute and really passionate about helping everyone grasp the language. You eat a lot in class, too!
Karen made this class so enjoyable. She was a great teacher and very personable! I definitely recommend taking this class but ONLY with Karen :)
very good hebrew teacher
Absolutely wonderful

A very interesting person. HOWEVER, very disorganized. Takes too long to correct (i.e. upwards of 6 weeks, or never). Marks very well (high class average) and is willing to help a lot. But he is not always available, and rarely responds to emails (upwards of 4 weeks to get a response, or never). Great material. He is THE expert on this.
Definitely one of the best professor ever. Really caring and makes the class interesting. However, you need to work for those grades, it's not free. If you work hard, than it's a guaranteed A

By far one of my favourite professors at McGill. Lectures are incredibly engaging and I felt like I learned something new every time. Impressive educational background and overall just inspiring as a person. A definite female role model for me. Put in the effort and the grades and easy enough, its just memorizing concepts.

Ruthanne Huising has a great teaching style which includes interacting with students in class activities. Although she is a tough and bureaucratic grader. Her exams are based on memorization. She gives many tests throughout the year, even a week before finals. She has very limited office hours that occasionally get cancelled.
highly recommend, fascinating content with an even better professor

Honestly the best professor I've had at McGill so far. You can tell that she cares about her students and she cares about what she's teaching. A tough grader, but definitely fair. Very approachable and kind too.

Outstanding Professor. Lectures are interesting and she gives a lot of in-class activities so that students can get a better understanding of the subject matter. However, she does give a ton of reading and you need to be proactive to achieve a good grade. Tough on assignments but fair to slightly lenient on tests.
Best teacher ever! Amazing lectures, made class so interesting and engaging. Tough grader and a ton of reading but worth it. If you can take her, do it.
She's one of the best professor I've ever had! Avoid if you want a good grade though! It's also a very heavy course with her.

Lectures are crystal clear and very engaging. Definitely cares about her students and there for you in office hours. However, she grades papers and her midterm-quizzes incredibly tough to vague standards.

Best professor I've ever had. Ever. Ruthanne made an 8:30 AM class extremely bearable, and I cannot say that for many professors. Extremely engaging, very thought-provoking. Read the text, though. You WILL do poorly if you don't read.
Really cares for her students, the subject and teaching. One of the best profs I've met.

Best class I've taken with Desautels. Getting a good grade is possible if you follow the readings attentively, listen in class, and cultivate an interest in the subject. The readings are intriguing, the lectures are interactive, and the subject matter is extraordinarily applicable to everyday life. I consider her one of McGill's best.

Huising is a hard marker and she takes attendance every class. Don't expect to get a good grade with just your common sense because she looks for very specific buzzwords in her quizzes and exams. Lectures are boring but may interest you if you are interested in the topic. Stay away if you want a good grade but take her if you want to be inspired.
Greatest woman in the world.

the best prof i have ever had in my life and probably will ever have. no one that i have ever met has enjoyed this class unless she taught it, and she has inspired countless people to pursue jobs and majors and minors in the field. she is brilliant and helpful and inspiring and all around amazing.

She is a hard marker. Ask too much for an OB class. Workload is alot compared to other sections (ask you to write 5-7 pages for a 5% assignment, while other teachers only require 2-3 paragraphs). But she is a nice and helpful lady

Very inspiring professor who gives you tools to finding perspectives to OB. The course isn't exactly fun but as it is a core class, taking Huising adds value. Exams are graded pretty strictly so don't go thinking using common sense is enough, missing an important word of a concept would pretty much remove all your marks..

Helpful and clear professor, but the material isn't exactly challenging. She doesn't have much to explain other than present the models and their implications, which are all fairly intuitive. Unless you are truly invested in Organizational Behaviour, you'll end up finding the course and the professor pretty boring. Readings are more helpful than RH

She is simply the best prof I've ever had. She is fair and cares about her students. She finds ways of engaging a class of 150 in a subject that people are not excited about when they come to the first class. It's because of her that I decided to major in OB.

She is so approachable and will make sure that you understand where your grades are coming from. Wants you to participate in class and keeps the lectures relevant with clips and examples. Slides do not have info on them so going to class is a must or reading the readings. Overall does a really good job of teaching
Great lecturer. Knows her stuff and really wants you to learn. Actively participate in your interactive classes and learn all the material well before the exams if you want to do well.
How can anybody not like this woman?
Probably one of the best lecturers at McGill. Extremely approachable and is simply one of the best.
She's an amazing professor, I loved going to her classes, very approachable and friendly. She teaches a lot, and values your opinions.Attendance mandatory.
She is simply the best, the best prof so far.....I actually learned sth for a change!
SHES Amazing, Best teacher at McGill, 2 class with her. LOVE HER!!!! ;-) Take her!
SIMPLY THE BEST!
One of the best profs at McGill! She's super approachable and explains everything clearly. Absolutely amazing!
I took her for two OB classes. She is AMAZING. The most helpful, interesting and insightful prof i've had at mcgill.
Very good prof! best i had so far!
Great!
Best ever prof!!! Take her class if you ever have the chance to! She is one of the best profs you will ever get!!
Awesome! Take her class!
She is the best. So clear, so involved and so engaging.
Incredible intellectual. Taught me roots of rebellion and helped me re discover my love for history. He has passion for what he teaches, and loves what he does.

Good teacher. Cares about his students. He is pretty tough when it comes to grading essays, but I like the challenge. He is also hilarious when he has to talk about yonic symbolism and gets nervous. I would definitely take another one of his classes.
We studied basically every pre-1950 Canadian poet - Layton, Smith, Purdy - and though I went in thinking they'd be super boring, I came out loving Canadian literature. Great class.

However hard I found the grading (harder than any other grading Ive gotten for sure) I still felt guided. The feedback was a bit harsher than Id like but that other reviewer is right .... so much was offered to our class. I learned so much by reading essay intro samples.

such a coincidence that the course 'got worse' after the students below got bad marks! his marking is hard and i was upset about my first mark. but jeff did provide me with examples of "A" essays and helped me a ton with my introduction ... there was a lot of help in this course if you asked for help

I am genuinely disappointed in this class. The prof seemed so likable and interesting, and midway through the term, his demeanor changed, his lectures dragged on, and I found no reason to continue attending them. I received horrible marks on assignments that I felt confident about, and it has added so much needless stress to my semester.

lectures felt long, paper assignments were vague. wrote a decent paper and got a really bad grade on it. feel like the prof is too demanding and needs to lighten up. cool guy though, and willing to help out.
lectures were good, marking was tough.

reading the other comments, people seem really entitled. I guess if you dont want to work and feel like you dont have anything to learn, you wont like this prof. But me and several friends in the class felt like his extensive paper comments made us better writers and readers. You wont get an easy A, but youll learn something.
I learned a lot. I really appreciated this class.

Professor Weingarten makes you work for your grade, but you'd be hard pressed to find a prof anywhere who takes teaching as seriously as he does. He returned my essays with an incredible amount of feedback about syntax and content, and even helped me with my writing when the class had ended. Take his class- it will change your life.

I won't take another course with Weingarten. It seemed as though he had a lot on his mind, and his lectures were unfocused and boring. His power points left something to be desired. His exams focus on useless details instead of main concepts and it's clear he isn't worried about his students in the slightest.

Jeff is a young, hip new professor at Concordia. He seems to be easy-going and easily-approachable. The reading load for the course is maybe the lightest I've had in my entire undergrad, however, they tend to be monotonous-- he could choose better readings. He also seems to like what he's teaching Can Lit, but his lectures are dry and drag on.

Jeff Weingarten seemed like a nice guy who is genuinely passionate about the material he teaches. Unfortunately, he is not very good at teaching it and classes tended to feel long and boring. As well, quite frustratingly, he chooses the tiniest details from the lectures to ask about in exams.
he'll break you and make you. definitely worth the "slight" difficulty if you want a teacher who cares and who'll definitely improve your writing

Professor Weingarten, or J.A.W as we refer to him, is an amazing instructor. Not only will he help you improve your writing, he will also inspire you to learn more. Do not expect any easy grades, for he is somewhat of a tough marker. Having said that, his teaching skills are impeccable, and he genuinely cares about his students' success.
Good professor. That is all.

GREAT prof. He's not easy on grades, as he demands the best from his students. However, the feedback from his class is incredible, so you truly progress in your writing. Very attentive and always willing to help, he's one of the best profs I know and makes poetry an engaging subject. Do yourself a favour and take his class! It's worth it.
Great prof. He really helped me improve my writing. Poetry is so much more interesting to me now. I'd take his class again, for sure.
Great professor! He really helped me with writing. I'd take his class again.

Dr. Shearer is a passionate professor. She came to class well prepared and was always on time. The material was not of interest to me at first but became so as a result of this class. I would highly recommend!
A keeper! Karis is lucid and extremely helpful.
Dr. Shearer is a gem. She is very smart and VERY helpful.

Very chill guy. First half of the semester was pretty boring but it got progressively interesting. I probably put the least amount of effort into this course and I got my best mark in it. He gives a study guide pre-midterm and final-follow it and you'll do well. I loved the course, but many people hated it. It's all about what you're interested in!

Very nice & helpful, attendance not necessary but it helps when going over powerpoints b4 exam. Have a study group and you'll be fine. Not a strict marker & tries to make class interesting. Take home exam seems hard at first but it just takes long to complete. If you're not interested in archaeology, you will find this class rly boring
Good prof, gives study guides before exams which specify exactly what you need to know. Didn't really have to follow the textbook to follow his classes. Funny guy

The class is pretty easy, and he's a cool guy. You gotta give him props for talking about old rocks, but it's hard to keep an interest. Though his lectures are a little scrambled, he gives a clear outline of exactly what will be tested before exams.

I just took a course with Professor Jundt at Brown. He is an outstanding professor. His lectures were always interesting and the class discussions on the weekly readings were phenomenal. The weekly reading load was heavy, but always intriguing. He made the class enjoyable and was a fair grader. I highly recommend him to anyone.
AWESOME prof. By far my favourite thus far. Really straight forward class, fair exam, and interesting readings. would highly recommend.
Great guy! Learned a lot in his classes. Wish McGill had hung on to him :(

Terrific professor! He is the nicest and most caring guy. I didn't even like his narrative approach but he is so enthusiastic and smart I enjoyed the class. Exams are fair and he gives you a lot of flexibility with the papers - he say to "follow your passion." Take him if you can!

Best history prof at McGill. so interesting.. even though he reads of his paper (as mentioned below) it is still incredibly riveting information that you can tell he spent time putting together!! He will change your entire education experience!
VERY boring lectures (he reads from his notes the whole time). but very easy tests that are based totally on lectures and readings from the coursepack

There is always that one prof you'll never forget and this is Jundt. You won't regret taking him. He's fair and considerate. One of the best history teachers at McGill, great sense of humour! Study for the exams, work hard on the research paper and you'll do fine. McGill hold on to him!

The way some prof's teach a class is always going to be more to same taste's than others (re: more cultural narratives, less economic history, as was mentioned below) But the fact of the matter is, if you need extra help or guidance, Jundt is never, ever, going to let you down.

You can argue back and forth all you want about how well he teaches cultural narratives or how his understanding of economic history is (as was mentioned below) The way in which a professor teaches a course will always be more to some tastes than others. But the fact of the matter is, if you need help or guidance, he is never going to let you down.

Jundt is the best. Great lecturer, but more important he actually cares about students, and will force you to think in an entirely new way. If you want to find out what university should be about, take a class with Jundt
He IS very passionate, but his lectures are disorganized and he is always late for class.

the best prof i have ever had. ever. do yourself a favor and take one of his classes. the combination of brutal honesty, well-researched cynicism, and a dry sense of humor makes every one of the classes i've taken with him amazing. not the easiest, but definitely the most rewarding.

Very good professor, although with a very obvious bias towards a certain narrative of history. (I happen to agree with his perspective, but as one of the previous commenters correctly noted, he doesn't have much of a grasp on economic history.) I would definitely recommend his class though! I learned so, so much.

I`m surprised to see such overwhelming support for Jundt, perhaps a partial indictment of the quality of modern students, or maybe just because he`s rather easy. He`s incredibly disorganized and always shows up late. His grasp on economic history is rather weak. He is, as people suggest, passionate about the material, but in all not a great prof.

Jundt is wonderful, he is the reason I am a history major. he teaches american history in a way that makes it a study of the culture and the nation not just the events, and he does a remarkable job bringing together both the disparate views people held on events as the occurred, and the disparate views the discipline has had on those events since.

the person below is rediculous, Professor Jundt, after having taught me thrice, has time and time again proven himself to not only be more than capable of explaining any minute event in great detail, but also in providing intelligent and eye-opening analyses on the subject matter presented. He also grades with extreme care to ensure fair treatment

Lectures/reads from his own notes VERY quickly and with a lot of statistics. Classes feel more like a dictation than understanding historical events. He is, however, extremely passionate and knowledgeable about all the topics he covers, so if you want to learn from a incomprensible but well read prof, go for this class! (Course material is cool.)

Excellent professor! You'd be hard pressed to find a more dedicated, tolerant, or amusing teacher. Do everything in your power to get into his conferences; the TAs are robbing you of the full Jundt experience.

I've taken two classes of his, and both have been extremely rewarding. His lectures are interesting and well presented, his assignments are valuable (as opposed to being mere vehicles for marks), and his grading is fair. He is friendly and personable, I can't recommend him highly enough.
Incredible professor. I truly have never been taught by someone as dedicated and passionate as this man. Always willing to help. Actually listens to the opinions of students, and responds seriously.
keep on rockin in the free world.

Erm, I can't say I agree with much of what's been said here. He was incredibly disorganized and frankly, I found him somewhat arrogant. He taught my 300 level history class at a high school level. I hardly learned anything I hadn't already absorbed through common knowledge and previous history classes. Boring. Take a 200-level with him, maybe.
Such a great prof - knowledgeable, passionate, and approachable. No tricks at all, straightforward assignments. Entertaining lecturer but sometimes kind of disorganized. Overall highly recommended!
Entertaining!
interesting approach to teaching history...easy and interesting like no other history teacher i have had before! knows is topic very good class

Oh professor jundt how i wish you had a full-time position at mcgill. his class was so fun, entertaining and easy to understand. readings were mostly interesting and he's super charming and funny. loved him. needs to stay in montreal.
Fun class, nice, sympathetic teacher. Be sure to attend classes, worth the time. Mini-essay assignments, take home final exam and a research paper.

Such a sweet man! Classes were quite enjoyable, you can tell he takes a real interest in what he teaches. I would take hima again for sure. He lectures quickly though, so my notes were at times hard to follow. But his anecdotes helps you remember. The music put him over the edge, great choices! I would definitely recommend him.

Meh. He was alright at times, but I think very disorganised on a whole. Showed up late almost every class. On a whole, I felt most lectures were a waste of my time. Having said that, it's not a very difficult class.

Great prof. Really makes the lectures interesting (including pictures and music). It is key to come to class though because he doesn't post anything online. Overall a great addition to McGill's History department!

Jundt is great! He's really funny and passionate about the material, but you have to go to class because he doesn't post anything online. Sometimes lectures too quickly, but overall a great prof and a great class!

If you miss a lecture, you're done! No powerpoints, no lecture recordings, so you absolutely have to show up to class and take notes. A lot of readings, helpful prof, interesting, and questions for the exams are given out in advance so you can prepare... Good prof

I thought Rabbani was great. A really decent human being who clearly has a passion for the topic of development. She encouraged class discussion and promoted relevant out-of-class events. The assignments were quite interesting and required a decent amount of research. The final exam was fair. I'd take a class with her again for sure.

While taking the class I complained about it, but looking back she actually did a very good job at teaching the material. Her lectures were a good mix of presentations, and other media. She encouraged class discussion and presented practice problems in class. Overall I would take her again if I had a choice.

As you can tell from the previous comments, Mehnaz's course was very scattered. Overall the growth models were taught very poor, with the lecturer not really knowing what was going on. Its obvious the rest of the course is simply taken from the textbook and "expanded" upon. Overall I'd stay clear of this course until it changes hands.

An interesting course with relevant, useful material is wasted by the professor's unclear presentation. The lectures are not fun but necessary for a good grade on assignments. The assignments were quite interesting, but the marking was strange. The final was very decent but the strength of the course should be enough reason to take this course.

A good course, with interesting material, was wasted by unclear presentation. Professor's lectures are not enjoyable, but recommended for a good grade. Assignments are interesting, but the marking is strange. The final was fair and the strength of the course material is enough reason to take it. Just keep up with the readings.
a good prof, the material isn't very hard and she knows a lot about the material. sometimes sarcastic but she doesn't seem to be malicious.

The class is really interesting and she has a lot of relevant experience but she has trouble with the growth models. Take the time to understand the growth models at the beginning of the course, then the rest of the material isn't that hard.

Ok - yes, she's not a good lecturer BUT it's easy. you don't have to fully mathematically understand all the models (as long as you understand how to apply them), she posts all lectures online, it's a minimal work self-study class, don't have to read the txtbook, 50% final and 50% individual & group assignments

Really shouldn't be teaching this class- she has cool experience and is really legit but a terrible prof. She seems to think this is our only class and assigns lots of readings and videos on top of textbook readings, and expects that everyone will have time for it. Don't take this class with her

One of the worst lecturers I have ever seen. She is unclear, very disorganized and barely touches upon what is "important" for the class. Don't take this class, don't take it with her, avoid it completely.
- Has the IQ of a plant - Treats her class like children - Uses a wildly expensive, useless textbook - Did I mention she was stupid ?
Completely awful. Take another course.

The class is easy. But. she is an awful prof. She explains the more complicated economic models very poorly and only touches on them, whereas she spends ample time on redundant facts about Africa and Bangladesh. I know for a fact that 99% of that class feels the same way about her. But..I'd totally hit that ;)

Undoubtedly a bit condescending, but her sarcasm can be refreshing. Doesn't know the material theoretically as much as it seems she derives it from her own work with BRAC in Bangladesh, which is impressive. Receptive and in office hours, but lectures were kinda boring and she was fairly unpracticed at providing compr. answers to questions in class.

She speaks at lecture like a substitute teacher would in front of high schoolers. Clueless, rude, an embarrassment to every economics prof that ever walked the earth. I hope she gets her sorry ass fired so none of you guys have to see it first hand. Having said that, the class is only a little difficult. Study the $250 textbook, and you'll get a B.

I bet she wrote the rating below mine herself.. absolutely awful with no regard for her students whatsoever. Extremely condescending in a very passive aggressive way and she'll often mumble something really inappropriate under her breath

I disagree with the bottom two, there is only so much one could cover in a summer course, and i believe she did a good job in doing this. This course is not difficult, as long as you do the readings and attend class. In all, she's a fair marker and knows the material well.

One of the worst professors at Mcgill University. I am still not sure why she was chosen to teach. She lacked mathematical knowledge necessary to explain the development theories. Tried to make the class as boring as she could. The best advise i can give is DONT chose a course the is teaching!!!!!!
Horrible and doesn't know anything. Very opinionated and unfair.

He's pretty good at answering most questions both in class and after/before class. Helpful with problems with posted material (slides, lecture recordings). He has a hard time understanding why you don't understand the material right away and never gives more explanation to clear up common mistakes people make.
Really knew his stuff, had very interesting first-hand stories relating to topics we studied.

Explains things really well, and very fair exams. A bit of accent, but totally understandable. No need for textbook at all; Fenster + Schirrmacher combo with class notes and posted assignments will do.
Excellent knowledge of course material; very accessible and open to questions. The course material is fairly basic so there's not too much opportunity for innovation in teaching it.

After BIOC212, I was extremely scared for 311. However, Julie St-Pierre made BIOC lectures easy to understand and enjoyable. I enjoyed learning about metabolism for the first time ever. She makes everything very clear and her questions are fair. She even gave 5% extra credit on the final for reviewing guest lecturers :)

Very comprehensive lecture slides (so you can actually learn in the class rather than just trying to write everything down), really clear explanations of recurring themes and concepts, straightforward exam if you study well.
Best of the 5 professors teaching 311. Clear, concise, to the point. Knows which parts are hard to grasp by students and emphasizes on those.

It was the 3rd class I had about metabolism and I was worried as I always have a hard remembering all that stuff, but it was in the end the class in which I did best due to her! Really complete slides, clear explanations; if you can have that teacher for a metabolism class, do it.

To me, J. St-Pierre though the most difficult subject to teach in the filed of biochemistry (METABOLISM) in the best way possible. It was very clear and she managed to make me interested in those super-complicated metabolisms pathway. I don't know how she did it she is a great teacher.

One of the best profs I've had. She's always willing to take answers during the lecture and go over the material again if the students need that. Exam questions are really fair. Slides are clear and she explains things in a clear and concise manner. Definitely recommend her.

Slides are very clear, lectures are clear too but sometimes a bit difficult to follow since the material can be a bit dense, but if you take the time to go through it by yourself and you study properly, you're guaranteed an A. Super fair exam questions, and she always does her best to answer questions in class.
Easy midterm, amazing slides, super clear , she's awesome
The best professor to teach BIOC 311! She explains everything clearly, and keeps you interested in the topics. Can't help it if there's a ton to learn, it's biochemistry son!

Pros: Friendly, approachable Professor. Teaches in a clear manner, lectures are recorded, and she explains concepts sufficiently. Cons: large amount of material, short answer questions on exams range from fair to requiring detailed memorization of pathways.

She covers A LOT of material each lecture and expects you to know almost everything extremely well for the exams. Her short answer questions require comprehensive knowledge of the metabolic pathways, their regulation, and the novel facts she presents in class (eg. glycogen storage diseases, poisons, etc). Her actual teaching skills are fairly good.
exams were not representative of materials taught
not clear on whats important & whats not. needed to read the book for everything because she explains things poorly.
I honestly think she and Kiss are the best teachers of this class. She is clear about everything. Exams are fair, in my opinion, if you study.
liked her until I got my midterm back
I agree she tells you everything you need to know but you have to know everything she tells you. She just has really high expectations of how much detail you have to know. Nice but tough.
She's clear but very picky when she marks her exams. Looks for specific wording.

I don't know what the first few people were talking about either... St.Pierre's slides were crystal clear and her exam was fair... however you OUGHT to know everything, even if she tells you not to (structures, pathways, enzymes, etc. it helps)
DOn't know what the first few reviewers were thinking... her exam was clearly straight forward and told us EVERYTHING we needed to know.
She's super nice and tells you everything you need to know for her exam. Her midterm was extremely straight-forward. You study. you pass. guaranteed.
Easy exams!!!! Easy easy easy. As long as you study all the material and do the questions on the textbook easy 100.

He was very passionate about the content (stats), but he struggled to transform this passion into effective teaching. Lectures often devolved into the professor sharing personal anecdotes or discussing content unrelated to the course. Most of my learning in this course was from the textbook. He is a very kind, personable, and understanding person.
vahid is the best!!!

Prof Partovi Nia tries to teach his students well, and his tests/assignments are mostly out of the book. That being said, the pace of the course is quite difficult, as a majority of the course (~3 chapters) was taught in the last month. Keep up with everything and you'll be fine.

Adam is the BEST Prof! (or lecturer which the Math Department lists him as) Far more competent than any other Math Professors at McGill I've encountered so far. He's very clear and goes over the foundations of the material well. Also very funny oh and I would recommend going to Office Hours to survive this challenging course.

Class starts off easy but quickly spins out of control. He's young and knows exactly why you're there...because your faculty made you, and he's not blind to this fact. He's very approachable and funny. A couple days before the exam, he booked a room and did a 3 hour review session. He really does care.
very nice prof, extremely friendly and patient. a young, energetic person.
Great prof. He's fun, clear and understanding. If you take this course make sure that you are with this guy.
Excellent teacher, makes things very clear, makes himself accesible via office hours and email, and is very friendly. Great lecturer, makes class enjoyable.
Amazing Prof
amazing!
he's very helpful, he puts a lot of effort into helping his students out unlike most professors.
Very nice, helpful, and great teacher!

The BEST. Her slides are super clear and well organized. She explains the material super well. I saw her explaining to a student the class material from A to Z at the midterm viewing, like WOW no professor does that! I love her she is funny and keeps the class interesting. You have to study hard but her questions are not meant to trick you

This lady gave enough lectures in my BIOL 112 class that I figured she deserved her own spot! Very clear and obviously knows what she's talking about. Gets through the material quickly and efficiently (almost always ends early) and is easy to listen to.
Very good lecturer. Clear, good use of examples to illustrate, available to answer questions. Recommended.
Really nice guy knows his stuff. Was clear at explaining the concepts. Overall a great course.

The nicest professor I had this year. He did a remarkably good job at deviating from the typical reading-off-the-textbook style of many of the professors in the econ department, and managed to consistently provide real-world examples for much of the content we studied.
Absolutely amazing, microecon was never so clear. Very patient and helps you work through the details.

One of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. Really helpful, relatively new to the job and still inexperienced but his lectures were interesting and his real life examples were very worthwhile. In a couple of years this guy should be tops in the econ department

Really nice guy, just very new to teaching. Way too much content for such a small time frame. This semester he tried to cover 5 chapters more than the other Econ 209 classes, and as a result nothing I learned in class really 'stuck'. His final also has 70 multiple choice questions more than the other teacher, with the same time frame.

I think he's a good professor for basic economics class. I've took econ208 class with another professor and it was really pain in the ass to study the whole book by myself in preparation for the exam because she didn't help much. But professor Forte, his lectures were helpful and worthwhile to attend cuz he wasn't repeating the book but explaining
too bad teacher

Amazing prof. Is extremely clear and helpful. Uses tons of examples and makes the material come to life. Our final was much easier than I expected it to be and prof. Regier even gave us hints during the exam. A BEAST!
Amazing prof, and a great teacher. Did anyone else think he seemed a bit too flamboyant to be married? Either way, I'd hit that.
Amazing Prof, really passionate about his field, humourous, and most of all ALWAYS willing to help you out.
such an awesome teacher and is really endearing. Would take him again. He follows the textbook pretty close and has lots of examples
such an awesome teacher and is really endearing. Would take him again. He follows the textbook pretty close and has lots of examples

What a pleasure to attend this class! The material was explained fabulously in class, the discussions were challenging and interesting, and there was always a chuckle to be had. Nothing better than a prof who knows his area inside and out, is sensitive to the seriousness of the issues at play, and can still have a dry laugh in the face of it all.
Fantastic teacher. One of those people you wish were your neighbour so you could learn from them everyday beyond university. Clear + passionate. One of my favourite classes!

Very nice person. Very student-friendly. Summary is great for that class. Essay is theoretical but he gives a lot of time to prepare. Classes are a bit dull but he has a great sense of humour! Where is he situated on the political spectrum? REAL DEVIL'S ADVOCATE... but I still think he is an anarchist!
Accessible, willing to help, good sense of humor and left sided thought. Fair grader.
Classes were alright, but final exam was a killer.
A slice of alright.
Frighteningly articulate.
An excellent prof. Clear lectures, very organized. Nice person.

(Not for CMLproperty as indicated above). Not great. Prof. doesn't like being challenged. Tries to appear open to different perspectives but doesn't respond to different takes well. All over the place. Plays favourites big time. Don't take if you have choice.

Amazing Professor! She is very chill and approachable. BUT CAREFUL, her grading is super strict and she doesn't follow clear guidelines. Nonetheless, she is an awesome human and her classes are great! When she teaches her own area (i.e. IP and CML prop.), FIRE. Super engaging and interesting. Don't expect to learn anything in the civil law though.

Boring lecturer. Not very organized. Likes an alternative (ie feminist approach) - which is great if you want to major in those things, but boring if you're interested in actually learning common law property. Grading criteria for term essay were unclear despite her attempt to make it otherwise. There are far better professors at McGill.

Her understanding of the law is very good. Her understanding of pedagogy is GREAT. She's one of the most open, approachable, and helpful profs in the faculty, both in the classroom and out. Great use of group work, tech, and the interactive classroom, too.
Really open and upbeat professor. Definitely excited about what she teaches. She is well versed in her field and offers up to date examples in class. She is a very promising up-and-comer.
No Comments
Great, organized, and good discussions in class. Uses powerpoint but uses it as an aid, not a crutch. Approachable and has reasonable expectations.
No Comments

He does not seem to know his information very well. When students ask him questions, he has a hard time trying to explain the concepts. The textbook is also not very clear, but if you end up memorizing the right information, you will do fine. Not a good class to take unless you are very passionate about music history.
Well done!

I really recommend this class. Attending was like a little vacation in my schedule, since the lectures were so interesting and fun. I think the best part was being allowed to write a paper on whatever you wanted, so you could learn about what truly interests you. Prof is funny, friendly, and straightforward too.
he's great!

Great prof. Extremely interesting and enlightening class. One of my favourite parts was that the final paper was not a specified topic or question, but very broad which meant you could hone in on whatever area you wanted to learn more about (or maybe that you are already knowledgeable about),making it much more enjoyable to write.
best class ever.
No Comments

Prof Ethen handled the large class size beautifully. He was always cracking jokes and making sure he had input from students throughout the entire class. He was aware when the content being taught was a bit more dry and did his best to ****e it up. Even though this course is typically known as a bird course, class attendance was always high.
very bright, clear, helpful, and also down to earth with a good sense of humour. Kind of awkward sometimes, tho.
Toni is awesome!
No Comments
greatest prof at mcgill there should be more like him a real pro

Prof. Blumer is a great prof! Gives out his cell-phone number instead of office hours. Wants students to do well and is always willing to help/re-explain till it's clear. Is a very practical teacher and knows what he's talking about. Takes the material out of the textbook and applies it to real life. TAKE THIS PROF!!!

Joel is such a sweet guy. He is willing to help students. Will give extra help. Assignments can be a little tricky. He asks questions I wouldn't expect and really makes you think hard. Very fair marker. Overall great guy

Dr. Deshaye is an excellent professor. He is very engaging and displays an obvious passion for English Literature. My writing greatly improved because of him, and I am motivated even more than before to do my best. This professor is very witty, and clever, and not at all intimidating.

Not only did Joel help improve my writing, he also made me realize why I am a Literature student. Apart from being an excellent lecturer, he is very approachable and is always willing to help with assignments. All in all, he is an amazing professor.

WONDERFUL PROF! First class, I was a bit hesitant. He has a tendency to be very politically correct and speak a bit...slowly. But give him a chance, and he'll totally win you over. And he honestly cares about helping you become a better writer. Put in the effort, do some work/studying yourself, and an okay grade is not beyond your grasp. Love JD!

I can't say enough great things about Dr. Deshaye. Not only is he funny and charming, but one of the most helpful and engaging professors I've ever had. Your writing will improve, as will your love for literature. Loved Margaret Atwood before, now I'm obsessed! Do yourself a favor and take anything he teaches!
Excellent professor. My writing has improved immensely thanks to him. He is also very helpful. One of the few profs at McGill who actually know how to TEACH and not lecture.

Dr. Deshaye truly reminded me of why I wanted to be an English major! Class is interesting and engaging.
